ComicInfo.Summary:
Sitting in the theater of Alan Moore's imagination you begin to notice some rather disturbing things. The floors are wet and the seats are tacky and have a noticeable smell of rot. A female usher walks down the aisle dragging a limp leg and shining a muted yellow beam filled with dust and debris into your eyes as she passes. You catch glimpses of seedy characters and acts happening around you. But the lights have gone down and the show is beginning. Enjoy a front row seat to the biggest names in comics delivering their finest works, all in luscious black& white. This issue continues Cinema Purgatorio by Alan Moore and Kevin O'Neill, A More Perfect Union by Max Brooks and Michael DiPascale, Code Pru by Garth Ennis and Raulo Caceres, Modded by Kieron Gillen and Ignacio Calero, and The Vast by Christos Gage and Gabriel Andrade. Each story has its own cover by the series artist and there is also an Ancient Tome Premium edition limited to 1000 copies.
*List of covers and their creators:* | Cover | Name | Creator(s) | Sidebar Location | |-------|---------------------------------------------|-------------------|------------------| | Reg | Regular Cover | Kevin O'Neil | 1 | | AT | Ancient Tome Premium Cover, Limited to 1000 | Ignacio Calero | 2 | | PU | Perfect Union Cover | Michael DiPascale | 3 | | MC | Modded Cover | Ignacio Calero | 4 | | CP | Code Pru Cover | Raulo Caceres | 5 | | VC | The Vast Cover | Gabriel Andrade | 6 |
ComicInfo.Title: Mommy's Boy; A King at Twilight
ComicInfo.Writer: Alan Moore,Christos N. Gage,Garth Ennis,Kieron Gillen,Max Brooks
